news.title: US Launches 'STEM Scholars 2025' Grant for International Students
news.description: The US Department of Education has introduced the STEM Scholars 2025 Grant, providing up to $20,000 in financial aid for international students pursuing advanced degrees in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics.
news.content:
In a move to strengthen America’s leadership in STEM innovation, the US Department of Education has announced the STEM Scholars 2025 Grant. The initiative will fund up to $20,000 per year for top-performing international students in STEM programs at accredited US institutions.

The program aims to attract global talent in artificial intelligence, data science, biotechnology, and climate technology. Recipients will also gain mentorship access to industry professionals and university research labs. Applications open in November 2025 for the Fall 2026 academic intake.

news.title: US Universities Dominate Global Rankings 2025
news.description: Harvard, Stanford, and MIT continue to lead in global university rankings, maintaining the USA’s strong reputation for academic excellence and research output.
news.content:
The 2025 QS World University Rankings reaffirm the United States’ dominance in higher education, with five US institutions in the top 10 and over 30 in the top 100. MIT retained its number-one position for the 13th consecutive year, followed by Stanford University and Harvard University.

Experts attribute this continued success to strong research funding, cutting-edge facilities, and extensive collaboration between academia and industry. For international students, the rankings highlight the breadth of opportunity and innovation available across the American education system.

news.title: US Streamlines Student Visa Process for 2026 Intakes
news.description: The US State Department has announced new measures to expedite F-1 visa approvals, reducing interview wait times and expanding digital document submissions.
news.content:
To support a record number of student applicants, the US State Department has introduced several enhancements to the visa process. These include expanded appointment slots at embassies, online verification systems, and faster processing times for F-1 and J-1 visas.

The improvements are part of the 'Study in the USA 2026' initiative, designed to make higher education in America more accessible to global learners. Officials predict that average visa processing time will drop from 8 weeks to under 4 weeks by 2026.

news.title: University of California Expands Sustainable Campus Program
news.description: The University of California system has launched a new Sustainable Campus Initiative to promote renewable energy, green infrastructure, and environmental education across all ten campuses.
news.content:
The University of California (UC) has committed to becoming the first public university system in the world to achieve full carbon neutrality by 2035. As part of its Sustainable Campus Initiative, UC will invest in solar farms, electric transport, and sustainable housing for students.

International students will have opportunities to participate in research on environmental technology, policy innovation, and renewable energy deployment. The initiative also includes new scholarships for students in environmental sciences and public policy.

news.title: US Tech Firms Partner with Universities to Offer Paid Internships
news.description: Leading American tech companies such as Google, Microsoft, and Tesla are collaborating with universities to provide paid internship programs tailored for international students.
news.content:
Major technology corporations in the United States have joined forces with top-tier universities to create structured internship pipelines for international students. The initiative provides hands-on experience in AI, robotics, and cloud computing, ensuring students are industry-ready upon graduation.

Participating institutions include MIT, Carnegie Mellon, and the University of Texas at Austin. The program aligns with America’s push to foster a skilled global workforce capable of contributing to the nation’s growing innovation ecosystem.

news.title: Post-Study Work Opportunities Expanded for STEM Graduates
news.description: The US government has extended Optional Practical Training (OPT) for STEM graduates, allowing them to work for up to three years after graduation in relevant industries.
news.content:
The Department of Homeland Security has expanded Optional Practical Training (OPT) for STEM graduates, enabling them to stay and work in the US for up to 36 months after graduation. The policy aims to attract and retain top international talent in technology and science-related fields.

The updated rules also include stronger employer compliance measures and clearer pathways for transitioning to H-1B and permanent residency visas. Universities and employers have hailed the move as a strategic step to reinforce America’s role as a global innovation hub.
